description: Number of ordered rooted trees with n edges such that the rightmost leaf of each subtree is at even level. Equivalently, number of Dyck paths of semilength n with no return descents of odd length.
comments: Sums of two consecutive terms are the Catalan numbers.Prime p divides a(p-1) and a(p+1) for odd primes where 5 is a square mod p (A038872(k)). - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jul 01 2006Hankel transform of 1,1,4,.. is A167477.Hankel transform of a(n+1) (starts 0,1,1,4...) is -F(2n). [_Paul Barry_, Dec 16 2008]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
formula: a(n) = Sum((-1)^i*C(n-1-i), i=0..n-2), where C(n) are the Catalan numbers.G.f.: (1 - 2*z - sqrt(1 - 4*z)) / (2*(1+z)).a(n) = binomial(2*n,n)/(n+1)*hypergeom([1,n+1/2],[n+2],-4). - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 15 2012Conjecture: n*a(n) +3*(-n+2)*a(n-1) +2*(-2*n+3)*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 30 2012G.f.: 2/(G(0)-2*x)/(1+x) where G(k) = k*(4*x+1) + 2*x + 2 - x*(2*k+3)*(2*k+4)/G(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Apr 06 2013a(n) = A168377(n,2). - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Feb 09 2014a(n) ~ 4^n/(5*sqrt(Pi)*n^(3/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 13 2014
